channel.title: Some fucked up shit
channel.description:
http://www.wnd.com/?pageId=22266
That was in my town. My brother went to school with the girl that was murdered. It happened in 2002-2003.
Discuss how fucked up this person is.

item.title: Some fucked up shit

What a prick, I would kick his skinny ass. Then fucking murder him see how he likes it lawl

item.title: Some fucked up shit
item.dc:creator: @jc22493 Jc22493
item.description:
@jc22493 wrote:

[quote=“blakeman8192, post:13, topic:365916”][quote author=Jc22493 link=topic=462114.msg3381044#msg3381044 date=1288037001]

It disgusts me when people blame video games for violence.

They’re simply taking the responsibility of the crime away from the fucked up individual. Any reasonable (not-fucked-up) person has no problem discerning video games from reality. The problem is the kid, not the games he plays. I’ve played GTAIII, GTA Vice City, GTA San Andreas, and GTAIV since I was like 10 years old, and I haven’t killed anyone.

EDIT: Yeah, if you read that kids quotes, he’s clearly fucking insane.

Although adolescents that play violent video games do tend to be more violent.
[/quote]Where are you getting this information?[/quote]
You’d know if you read.

Read full topic

item.title: Some fucked up shit
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

[quote=“rip4d, post:17, topic:365916”][quote author=Davidi2 link=topic=462114.msg3381136#msg3381136 date=1288041532]

[quote author=blakeman8192 link=topic=462114.msg3381080#msg3381080 date=1288038855]

[quote author=Jc22493 link=topic=462114.msg3381044#msg3381044 date=1288037001]

It disgusts me when people blame video games for violence.

They’re simply taking the responsibility of the crime away from the fucked up individual. Any reasonable (not-fucked-up) person has no problem discerning video games from reality. The problem is the kid, not the games he plays. I’ve played GTAIII, GTA Vice City, GTA San Andreas, and GTAIV since I was like 10 years old, and I haven’t killed anyone.

EDIT: Yeah, if you read that kids quotes, he’s clearly fucking insane.

Although adolescents that play violent video games do tend to be more violent.
[/quote]Where are you getting this information?
[/quote]The many studies? I was actually just reading my course book for Health, and it specifically states that children that are exposed to violence (media [movies, games, news etc], at home, etc) are more likely to be violent.
[/quote]It doesn’t mean they will be.[/quote]No one said it was a sure thing. Jc said they ‘tend to’ and I said it’s ‘more likely’. But it has been proven.

Read full topic

item.title: Some fucked up shit
item.dc:creator: @T3arful T3arful
item.description:
@T3arful wrote:

How can people even blame Rockstar for kids shooting people? The game is rated 18, if a kid loses it and decides to shoot people and claim GTA as an ‘inspiration’ then the Parents are obviously not doing what they should be doing, so they should be the ones to blame, not Rockstar.

Read full topic

item.title: Some fucked up shit
item.dc:creator: @_Rich Rich
item.description:
@_Rich wrote:

That’s fucked up.

But this part:

In October, attorney and activist Jack Thompson filed a $246 million lawsuit against Sony Computer Entertainment America Inc., GTA III designers Take-Two Interactive Software and Rockstar Games, and Wal-Mart, in connection with a Tennessee case in which two teenage stepbrothers killed one person and injured another by shooting rifles at passing motorists, the Scene reported. The teens claimed GTA III as inspiration.

“I think the video game industry is about as evil as any entity in America is,” Thompson told the paper. “I’m out to take their money from them – and it’s blood money, in some of these instances – and give it to the people who have been harmed by them.”

…

“We are on a crusade,” he told the paper. “We’d like to see everybody who has one of the [games] turn them in, like they do with rifles and pistols. We want to put them out of business.”


niggerisusrs.jpg

Read full topic

item.description:
@chassy13 wrote:

[quote=“ChaosPkers, post:3, topic:365916”]thats a fucked up kid, whether he admits it or not.

…why do they blame gta??[/quote]

Many adults believe that violence in video games makes kids change. They say that if you kill people on a video game, you are less likely to feel the wrong in killing people in reality. Exactly as the article says, GTA is a common one.

Boy who killed girl: ‘I did her a favor’

Though an alleged teen killer claims a popular violent video game had nothing to do with his murdering a young girl, the victim’s father and others are convinced Grand Theft Auto III inspired the boy to bludgeon and stab his friend to death. Dustin...

That was in my town. My brother went to school with the girl that was murdered. It happened in 2002-2003.
